intro: Echinocactus tetracanthus, commonly known as the Mexican hat cactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems that are covered in spines, which provide protection from herbivores and reduce water loss. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking visual element to its desert habitat. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscape designs.
